artist: M. Egerton; George Hunt; Pyall & Hunt, London
creditline:
The Minnich Collection
The Ethel Morrison Van Derlip Fund, 1966
text: Not only does this print satirize the English climate, but also the fashionable city dandy who appears pathetically wet, thin, and effeminate as he tiptoes through the pouring rain, struggling to open his umbrella.
title: A Soaker or Real Cat and Dog Day
